LOVED THEM AND SO DID MY DH AND MY 20 month old

Couldn't have been a nicer tasting punch! The lime adds a great twist as does the apricot nectar! Will definitely enjoy this drink during warm weather! A keeper! [Made & reviewed for one of my adopted chefs in this Spring's PAC]

I love the Pioneer Woman however; it pains me to say that I found this recipe lacking in flavor. :( I used regular chicken broth rather then reduce sodium, added some onion powder and garlic powder for flavor. Even after all of this, I felt it was bland. After a couple bites I decided to add some shredded cheddar cheese to make it a creamer and thicker texture...and of course more flavor. I highly suggest adding cheddar cheese to this recipe, it really makes it a 4 star recipe after doing so. I'm still a huge fan of Ree and her recipes. :)

Scrumptious! I was concerned the lemon might be too lollipop, but it was a lovely and delicate and the limoncello came through but wasn't too boozy. I made coconut pecan shortbread cookies and crumbled them on top and I made the limoncello. The cookies were perfect with it, a little crunch is always a good thing!. I used full fat vanilla ice cream and made a smaller serving . Made for SWT2018 A Sweet Taste of Argentina challenge by one of the Pantry Pirates

I just loved these green beans!  I didn't have fresh, so used whole frozen green beans, thawed and rinsed.  The mix of peanut oil and sesame oil, combined with the soy sauce is spectacular!  A definite do again recipe.  I plan on enjoying this often.
I was looking for a recipe for a drink using Cachaca other than a Caipirinha (which is a great drink, by the way), and the Cachaca Fizz did not disappoint. Refreshing!  Thanks for sharing!

This is really terrific.  I threw in some peas with the corn and some cayenne pepper for more heat.  Even with turkey bacon, this recipe is a keeper.  I found this recipe in Cookingclub.com August/September 2009.  Thanks for posting!

This was excellent, moist and tender and very flavorful! My loin was around 2lbs, no fat needed trimming. It was a section I cut from 6 lob loin I bought at Costco, and though the other recipe I made for the other part was good this was so much better. One thing I think that made a difference, is that I browned the meat in olive oil in my cast iron frying pan before spreading on  the peanut butter mix. The searing of the meat helped to keep in the juices and made it much moister and added to the flavor. I drained off the oil after broning and roasted the meat in the frying pan. I warmed the p'nut butter and soy a little which helped to incorporate them better - just 15 secs in the microwave. I couldn't find pineapple perserves so I mixed 1/2 cup of peach jam with about 4 oz of drained crushed pineapple, because of the size or my pork loin I knew it would take longer to cook, so I just waited till it reach 150 degrees before spreading on the jam mix. It's hard to describe how wonderful the flavor combination of this dish is. The p'nut butter isn't over powering but it's there. The fruit mix is lucious slightly sweet but savory with the pork juices, and the red pepper gives it a subltle  warmth. The only thing I might change is the name of the recipe - I think the peanut butter in the title might scare some people from trying it : )  I think I found the first entry in my "Top 20 for 2008" cookbook,   thanks Nimz for sharing.

This is an EXCELLENT microwave risotto. The directions said to cook on HIGH for the mushroom/onion mixture, but no temperature was given for the rice. I cooked it on HIGH for 13 minutes, stirred and cooked another 13 minutes. I used the white wine-it made the dish. I skipped the parmesan at the end.
Great for the lunch boxes and so quick to do !! Made for Everyday is a Holiday.

Recipe.Title: Savory Roast Pork With Apples and Parsnips

Text: Great use of contest ingredients.   Followed your recipe, with the exception of adding a little soy to the gravy!    We really enjoyed it!

Recipe.Title: Chicken Floating in Curried Coconut Soup

Text: A spicy soup full of depth. I didn't have galangal, Kaffir leaves or tamarind paste, and used yellow curry powder instead of red paste. The soup was a big hit. -Thanks so Much!

Recipe.Title: Fig and Blue Cheese Stuffed Pork Tenderloin

Text: I made this for friends and everyone loved it!  I baked it at 400 for 40-45 minutes until it reached an internal temp of 160. I will be making this dish again!  I also did not use the apple jelly.  Instead I made a red wine reduction with the remaining figs, chicken stock, rosemary and a tablespoon of butter.  The porkloin was great alone or with the sauce.
I scaled the recipe down a little and used it in my ABM. Perfect. A nice basic loaf! Made for Saucy Silverados and the ZWT 9 tour!

This was a big hit with my family and will quickly become a favorite.  I added a little chili powder, doubled the garlic and the green chilis.  I used small white beans rather than the white kidney beans and did not use any canned corn.  It made great tacos the next day.  Thank you for posting this recipe!

This was a nice blend of seasonings in which nothing really overpowered.  It was a little messy to work with - I got it back in the box but unmolding it was not as clean as I had hoped.  Still, it's an easy spread to whip up and seems to be liked by everybody.  Thanks for sharing!  Made for Spring PAC 2013.

Recipe.Title: Kittencal's Grilled Cheese and Tomato Sandwich

Text: I've been making a similar sandwich since I was a kid. I double the amount of cheese, though, and use mustard instead of mayo. There's just something I find off-putting about warmed mayo. Plus, I find mustard just blends better with melted cheese.

A tasty recipe that easy goes from breakfast to appetizer. I made mine big and thick as a savory breakfast side but think small thin ones would make a great appetizer. Not sure what swiss brown mushrooms are so made mine using baby portabellas and also used whole wheat flour, did cut the recipe in half and still had what we thought was four good size servings. Thanks for the post.

This was definitely a change of pace from your typical beef roast.  I had a beautiful sirloin tip roast that was almost 4 pounds.  I used dried marjoram and basil, and then added some fresh thyme sprigs to the slow cooker liquid for extra flavor.  I also used the balsamic vinegar.  It smelled heavenly when cooking, which took 6 hours.  The beef was super tender.  I found that the vinegar really overpowered the other flavors, however.  I think, perhaps, if I thickened the remaining juices and made a gravy, it would have been nice.  I did serve this with horseradish mashed potatoes, as suggested, which complemented it nicely.  Thanks for sharing.

1 STAR  I really wanted to like this recipe. sugar free chocolate cake, perfect! Since the photo showed cupcakes, I baked them in a muffin pan with liners. When I took the pan out of the oven the batter had boiled over leaving a crater in each cupcake, and crusty mess on the bottom of my oven. Now I have to clean my oven before I can try a new recipe. Since the photo shows successful cupcakes, the problem might be our 7,000 elevation. Things boil more readily here.

I love a good beef brisket, but who has the time to smoke for 8-12 hours.  I was a little apprehensive putting in an expensive peice of meat into a crockpot.  I followed directions with 3 lbs of brisket and really just guessed on proportions of other ingredients.  Cooked for 24 hours and was a little dry and did not really taste the flavor.  Added the extra ingredients and cooked for an hour.  It might have been my proportions but not quite enough sauce.  However after 1 hour meat was still a little dry but flavor was awesome.  Put on buns with slaw and some pickles, I added a little extra bottled bbq sauce on mine.   It was delicious and my son said just as good as the Dickey's Westerner sandwich (a local bbq shop we hit from time to time).  My daughter ate hers which is a big deal.  Overall it was excellent due to ease of preperation and taste.  Will definately make again and wish I had taken a picture of it for everyone to see.  I can't imagine many people are going to make 8 lbs at once so I would recommend a little larger proportions on finishing sauce.  Try it you won't be dissappointed.

This was easy and yummy!!  I used a chuck steak that was about 3 inches thick and cut it into chunks.  I subbed thyme for basil, no basil to be found. When i came home for lunch it smelled delicious but I had to add a bay leaf, a small one.  Left out the sugar, next time will add a couple of stocks of celery.  You could make this into strognoff easily by just adding sour cream the last 15 minutes.  I fixed egg noodles this time, but next time I think I will do rice.  This is a yummy come home to dinner!  Thank you DiB's for posting this, I will fix this again and again and again!

Wow! It seems a lot of hubby's are loving this recipe. Well mine did too! He really enjoyed the lack of tomato flavor. (Most have such a tomato taste to them). He enjoyed the added bacon and cheese but did miss the rice a tad. This is so easy to prepare and the flavor is just so different from what you are expecting that you truly end up tasting every bite because you just can not believe it! What a joy to eat. This is a keeper. Thanks for posing. :)
Made a key lime pie out of Key Limes----Great, A BIG HIT.

Made this tasty mousse today. It is a little too sweet for me; however, DH enjoyed it since he has a bit of a sweet tooth. : )  Next time, I will reduce the sugar significantly or will eliminate it completely.  This mousse comes together quickly and uses ingredients that you generally have in the pantry and who doesn't keep whipped topping on hand. : )  Made for the Sweet December tag game, December, 2014.
I made this dish with some Mexican rice. My husband and I loved it. It was so easy to make and I am not very good in the kitchen.

Recipe.Title: Vera's Roast Turkey Breast With Garlic and Thyme

Text: This was excellent, loved the garlic taste, it was in the inside and golden on the outside. My family was very pleased

Recipe.Title: Pasta With Toasted Walnut and Parmigiano-Reggiano Butter Sauce

Text: This was quick and simple, but very tasty!  The flavors compliment each other but the texture of the toasted nuts is what makes this dish.

This really deserves more then 5 stars, it is just a fantastic tasting soup!  I've only made tomato soup twice before and both those recipes were disasters.  I used only 1 onion since mine were very large.  Then did things just a little different in step 2.  I added 1 cup water after step 1 was done and nothing else.  Covered and cooked until carrots/celery were tender and liquid was reduced to 1/2 cup.  Added the tomatoes to cool it down then into the blender.  Back into the pot to reheat and I added the rest of the ingredients from step 2. Then added evaporated milk since I had that open and needed to use it.  I will make this again using the heavy cream and whip some up for the topping.   I love lazyme's photo and how she says it melts into the hot soup.  Made for *1 2 3 Hit Wonders* game 2007

This made for a wonderful meal...I made as directed but added a heaped teaspoon of Pepper Steak Seasoning (mixed ground pepper blend) to the sauce for a little bite. I also added a little extra water to thin the sauce slightly. The sauce would also be wonderful served over chicken breast.
Thanks for sharing :)
Followed the recipe exactly and it produced an absolutely delicous cake.  Very easy to make and the glaze was a perfect topper for the cake.  Made for Zaar Stars!

Recipe.Title: Spiced up Low Cal Hot Chocolate

Text: This gets a 5 for taste but only a 3 for instructions.  The spices will NOT dissolve.  I ended up straining and reheating the milk  before drinking it, because there was too much "grit" in the cup.  The flavor was very good though.  I used the ginger and the cayenne.  Made for Winter 2010 Comfort Cafe game.
Fantastic! I only used around 500g of roo fillets but used the full amount of everything else and served over a little pasta it made a wonderful dish for two.

This was Delicious and the stovetop did all of the work! I added 3 cups of mushrooms, cut in half and some fresh thyme from the garden. I served this with some rice, but I especially enjoyed dipping some sourdough bread into the sauce. Thanks for the wonderful recipe Poo!

Recipe.Title: Cheesy Scrambled Eggs . . . Low Fat, Low Chol, Low Sugar

Text: Delicious recipe that, although, it is Low Low Low it is delicious. I used 2 whole eggs and lite mozzarella cheese.  I did use a pat of butter on my toast.  I just can't sacrifice everything   Thanks for posting this definate do again recipe
Totally yummy!  I love sipping Amarula  and using it for cocktail is great.  It is a cousin of pina colada in a way.  Thank you for posting this recipe cookiedog.  It is

Recipe.Title: Jamaican Jerk Chicken With Pineapple Salsa

Text: This is a winner! I've made it twice now with great results. This is a great recipe for entertaining. It can also be frozen. I simply prepare the salsa and put in a ziploc bag and I mix the chicken breasts with the marinade and put them in a ziploc and freeze it all. When I'm ready to prepare it, I thaw the salsa and chicken. I also prefer to grill the chicken. I've never baked it. I think that grilling it really brings out the flavors.

Very good, and very rich!  I was amazed that a can of soup could taste this good. Next time I'll cut back a bit on the sherry, as it was a bit too assertive, but otherwise this was spectacular!  Thanks for posting!
Hey! This is really good!  I followed the recipe exactly, using chicken, green onion and nipa sap vnegar.  This is one that bears repeating!

Recipe.Title: Paula Deen/Bobby's Whole Wheat & Honey Pancakes With Honey B

Text: Perfect, healthier pancakes and the honey butter with lime zest is delicious!
I made this with Recipe #300047 resulting in a creamy pink drink! I did use a bit more then a dash. Thanks!
My boyfriend said this steak was delicious. I will be making steak this way often.  Thanks for sharing.
Yum, rolled mine in chopped dry roasted peanuts.

I made the whole recipe twice and each time I've made 7 burgers -- but I end up freezing for later.  So freakin' good.  I do add panko breadcrumbs and egg white to bind it.  The first time I made them I didn't seal the edges good enough, this time, I used the extra burger meat from what would have been burger #8 to seal the edges & fill any holes before cooking.
Thanks so much!
These are amazing!  For cookies that have no flour they are great.  I added mini choc chips in the last batch and they were even better.

*Excellent !*  As much as I love mangoes, I never thought of eating them with fajitas.  I made just as written but for adding some thinly sliced poblano pepper to the onion packet. The onions and pepper retained some crunch and paired well with the soft, sweet mango.  The steak was tender with a tart/peppery flavor.  This dish is just an all round winner for ease of prep, visual appeal and taste! *SURE* to be repeated many times in my kitchen!  Thanks for sharing!
lovely summer salad, I used no fat mayo and added some chopped celery, turned out nicely crisp and crunchy, delicious!  Thanks for posting, I will be making it again.
This is a great alternative when you're in the mood for coffee with a little more "oomph."  So easy and so cheap - who doesn't have cinnamon on hand? :)

Recipe.Title: Sassy Sweet and Savoury Pork Dinner

Text: I would have rated this a 5 but we hated the soggy panko. I used pork steaks and gala apples. We loved the idea of half an apple each and the apricot preserves was a nice addition. I plan on making this often without the panko (it doesn't need it) because it really looked impressive on the plate and tasted great. Thanks for the nice recipe and good luck in the contest.

Delicious. I made 4 biscuits using Recipe #260447 and the 4 made lunch for myself and DH. I had ham when I tagged this recipe but it was gone by the time I made it. We had Ham-less and Eggs Frittata Biscuits but they were still yummy. I used sliced low fat mozzarella because I was too lazy to grate it. Loved the pepper and tomato with the eggs. Made for Santa's Secret in Photo Tag.

I made this fruit salad on a Saturday and refrigerated over overnight to serve for breakfast on Sunday. Very easy to put together and loved all the flavors together except the pineapple seemed to us a bit to tart. Will be making this again but use crushed pineapple so it is not a strong flavor in the salad. Made and reviewed for My3Chefs - June 2012.

Recipe.Title: Pork Chops Stuffed With a Fruity Pecan Chutney

Text: I doubled the recipe. This chutney does give the other white meat lots of flavor! The rosemary and raspberry is just great in this. I used a mix of dried fruits including dates, plums, apricots. Taste buds are alive in this. I must say the title does state grill not broil and I did broil but next time grilling is a must. I really think that grilling would make this really excellent. There was a lot of filling so make sure to open the chops to generously fill. Thanks for the good eats.

Recipe.Title: Poached Eggs and Parmesan Cheese over Toasted Brioche W/ Pistou

Text: Just love the flavours of the egg, parmesan cheese on the slice of toasted wholemeal/wholegrain bread with the pesto on the side.  I scaled this back for 1 egg and 1 slice of toast and used some pesto I have previously made.  The only disaster I had and it hasn't happen in along time was in poaching the egg as the whites totally broke away from the yolk but it was still delicious. Thank you mary winecoff for a great breadfast, made for 123 Hits.

We really liked this recipe, and don't miss the fat at all. DH likes his french toast very soaked before cooking, so we doubled the liquid. Other flavor combos would work well here too, like Grand Marnier and OJ, or Amaretto and almond extract. The french toast would also be great with my recipe#242479. Thank you gertc!
I would give this one 5 stars but for me, the green onions were too much for some reason.  I'm going to try this again without the onions because then I think it'll be perfect.
Scrumptious and oh so easy.  Took some to a neighbor who asked for the recipe! Thanks!

I made this for dinner last night as I had lots of Vegemite on hand and pork loin. In the future, I would double the sauce (we're big sauce fans) and not bother with the Vegemite on the noodles~ just butter them. I doubled the tomato paste and vegemite in the sauce (as compared to the sour cream) and found it a better and more savory sauce. We'll definitely be making this again!

Fabulous drink recipe! We're huge fans of Grapefruit Absolute so this drink went over well with our family. We made it two different ways: one with sparking wine and one with sparkling water and grapefruit Abolute and they were both lovely! Garnished each drink with the star anise used in the syrup. Made for Spring PAC 2011.
I really enjoyed this even more than I thought I would.  Hit the spot after work while relaxing.  I kept it as a hot drink and topped with whipped cream.  I used milk instead of the creamer.
I am glad someone put a recipe for brussel sprouts on here!  This was good!
I love this.  I found it a great recipe to bring to a potluck.

What can go wrong with coffee, chocolate and almond? Nothing! Well, my first attempt went terribly wrong because my powdered almond milk turned out to be over - that was one terrible culinary accident LOL But when I used almond butter to replace almond flavor (can't find it in Germany) and milk, it was absolutely lovely! Used truvia for sweetening and 90 percent chocolate and could have had two mugs at once. This definitely is a keeper!! Thanks for sharing!
Made for Best of 2010.

Recipe.Title: Shirley Corriher's Chocolate Chip Cookies, Medium Version

Text: This recipe made really fluffy cookie dough!  I got 30 cookies, which came out just like your average, "medium" chocolate chip cookies.  The mix of butter and shortening, which I haven't used before in a cookie, is what gave that in between texture.  This is a great cooking lesson!  Thanks, Chocolatl!  Made for Zaar Stars, under the 24 hour rule.
great combination of flavours, will be making this again.

These muffins are delicious. I used fresh blueberries instead of frozen. I dipped the tops of the muffins in sugar mixed with a small amount of fresh, grated nutmeg after the muffins were removed from the pan and still warm. I didn't use paper liners thinking I wouldn't have a problem  since I was using sprayed, nonstick tins. Big mistake!  They stuck like glue. I'll definitely use liners next time.
Great sandwiches and easy to make too.

This is the best turkey burger I have ever had. I served on toasted onion rolls with sauteed mushrooms/onions. I didn't have a block of Swiss to grate so I just used a slice on top of the burger.  I used 85/15 ratio ground turkey, panko crumbs, and added 1 tbsp of Worcestershire sauce to the mix. I pan fried 3 minutes per side instead of using the Foreman since I had a hot skillet after toasting the onion rolls. This is a terrific turkey burger and it is much better than most beef burgers.
yummmy....I garnished one with edible rose petals, and enjoyed every bite!
This was easy & well received by everybody!  made for ZWT7.  :)
Oh so smooth, a really nice flavour combo.

This was terrific. I love that it wasn't runny.  It even makes kind of a crust on the bottom, which holds the pieces together even more. For my taste, there was a little too much topping relative to the rest of it, so next time I will scale that back just a tad. But a great recipe!
I make this. But instead of the Oreos I use Fudge Stripe cookies. I crumble the cookies on top and it is SO good.

These burgers have a nice taste but we were kind of disappointed by the texture.  It was too moist.  I would use less breadcrumbs another time.  I topped mine with mayo mixed with ketchup, a slice of monterey jack, a slice of tomato, pickled jalapenos and spicy mustard.  Thanks Lainey :)  Made for 123 hit wonders
GREAT drink! Smooth, sweet and melony. Freddy cat liked this ghostly green brew. Made for Zaar tag game.

I had bookmarked this to try when I read it in Rachael Ray's magazine. The weather is a little warm for chili, but this was sooooooo good. This will probably be my go to beef chili recipe now. It isn't spicy, but has just enough of a kick of flavor to make you want to keep eating and eating! My kids loved it too.

Excellent recipe!  Excellent quantity for a large crowd!  I doubled this for a 20  guest party and all I heard were RAVES!  Only used salami in several different flavors for the meat.  The marinade will join the ranks of a frequently used recipe & frequently shared!   Thanks for sharing this Vicki in CT!
I added just a bit of Half and half.. Yum!

A delightful salad made for my daughter's 21st birthday. I used fuji apples. As I only had ground almonds I first mixed the parsley and almond meal together and then sprinkled that on top. I'm really pleased I did add the almond meal and not omit it as I first thought. Great recipe Nyteglori.
I love blackberry pie.  This is a good recipe.  The only substitution I made was to use cornstarch instead of flour.  I used berries I picked this summer and froze.  Made for Culinary Quest 2014.

These Fauxtatoes are delicious!  They still tasted like cauliflower, but that's okay since I love cauliflower.  But they are so incredibly creamy!  They were a little thinner than mashed potatoes.  Yummy and a great way to use cauliflower.  Thanks for sharing!

ok but nothing great. glad I tried it.
thank you Chris.

I originally found this in a 1970s Betty Crocker cookbook. It's the exact recipe. Except it's not done in a Crock-Pot it's done in a very large fry pan. I always saute the onions first and then put the chops in and brown them good on both sides and then I add the rest of the ingredients and let them simmer for almost an hour. It's always a hit for the past 40 years it's always a hit!
I am always looking for something new for the kids. This recipe was fantastic. The minute my 5 yr. old smelled it cooking she wanted to eat. I will make this again and have already shared it too.
I made this for my mother in law for Mothers Day and it was fantastic! Easy to make and very rich! We added Garlic and Cheese croutons and it just gave it an extra kick!

GREAT TASTING FOCACCIA, & I thoroughly enjoyed making your recipe! The only change I made was to use lemon pepper instead of the usual S&P, but that's no biggie! This was made just for the 2 of us, but another time I'd love to share this with company ~ Definitely a keeper recipe! [Made & reviewed for the VIP chef in the Vegetarian/Vegan Recipe Swap 19]

Recipe.Title: Quick and Easy, Lightly Curried Cauliflower and Egg Cheese

Text: This is a delicious use of cauliflower and should appeal to those who may not normally care for it.  The sweetness and texture from the chopped boiled egg, mild sauce with a hint of curry, and the use of croutons make this recipe very, very special.  Thank you Karen for posting this yummy recipe!
It was ok. The kids did not particulary like it. My DH thought it was pretty good, I'm not sure if it was an error on my part or what but it was slightly more like a bread pudding than french toast.

Recipe.Title: Cool As a Cucumber!  Cheese, Cucumber and Chive Sandwich Spread

Text: We loved this on rye bread. I didn't exactly follow the recipe though. I simply mixed the cucumber with onion chive cream cheese. I forgot to get mint so didn't use it. Next time I'll try that. It doesn't get much easier and it was great. This would be good for a summer get together on rye crackers, melba toast or party bread (small square loaf made for tea sandwiches). Little sandwiches of this stuff on rye next to pumpernickle with salmon spread and white bread with veggie spread would be great! As you can tell, I'll be making this again. Thanks for posting.

This soup is amazing! I will definitely make again. We only had button mushrooms at home but they were an excellent replacement. Also, we used our canned carrots from our garden. Because they were soft from canning, I added them at the end. Healthy and yummy is hard to find. Thank you!
This came out awesome. I added pears to it. I think it could use more sugar, but other than that it was great thanks for sharing!

These are very easy and tasty.  I made with cocoa powder, but left out chips.  I also used a combination of Splenda and sugar.  Don't let the amounts of extract fool you.  It sounds like a lot but turned out just right in flavor.  I cut mine in half before the second bake.  Made for Fall 2007 PAC.
This is my Dad's favorite coffee cake. My family just scarfs it up. It is really, really good!

I am amazed! My DH asked if I could try to make some seaweed salad, (like the one he recently had a local restaurant) because he loved it! I had never had it, so went on an adventure in finding a suitable recipe. Of course, Rita would have it! I followed this exactly, and we both loved this....it was healthy, great tasting, and so easy! A must try!! Even if you think you won't like it, I loved it, and I never thought I would. Made for Diabetic Tailgate Party!
September 2012

We really enjoyed this dish.  It is very easy to make and the taste is awesome.  I made with olive oil this time but am going to try it with a combo of butter and olive oil next time as bet that will make it even more wonderful.  Thanks for posting this tasty way to eat zucchini.

Although I'm the kind of person who could eat carrots almost any ol' way & enjoy 'em, I must admit that this recipe really does dress them up with a lot of additional NATURAL flavor! And we enjoyed them with the cheese! So simple (Well, it does take quite a bit of time, but some of us have lots of that!) & so very flavorful! A delight! Many thanks for sharing the recipe! [Made & reviewed in 1-2-3 Hits recipe tag]

Oh, Kittencal how you have made my life so much better...and this recipe is no exception to all of the others of yours that I have tried!  Thank you SO MUCH for sharing this fantastic recipe.  These were so moist!! It was hard for me not to eat the entire pan!!  Nothing needs to be changed with this.  If it ain't broke...don't fix it!!!  ;-)

I had to sub the crisps for smashed up crackers, as none of the crisps in the house were of a suitable flavour....<br/>DH and I loved this.....kids not so sure, but I didn't care, as it meant more for me.....I could just eat a dish of this and nothing else ( in fact I almost did!!).....deeeelicious!<br/>Made for PRMR.
Doubled this and made a huge braided bread! Loved it! Tasted like my grandmas! Thanks so much!  ( I added a pinch extra yeast to it)

Made this recipe using Spanish cured chorizo.  Cut up the chorizo in small cubes and mixed it in the ground beef.  I followed the recipe for the dressing and think next time I'd cut it down in half because there was so much left over.  Would make this again - different spin on a burger :)

Sat. 8/04 - I had to convince my husband to let me follow this recipe rather than making the patties from ground turkey "straight" which is always too dry and bland for my taste. We both were thrilled with the results. Delicious moist burgers. Yum!! I did make a small change in substituting Lawry's seasoning salt for the oregano and celery seed. I added just a shake or two of garlic powder and onion powder along with the worcestershire sauce. I used panko style crumbs and probably a little less than 1/4 cup of shredded cheddar. I recommend grilling rather than pan frying. The grill really boosts the flavor. Thanks PdxBarb!!!

Update 8/24:  My husband could eat these turkey burgers everyday. He's really hooked on these burgers. I usually crave variety, but I agree with him. I double the recipe and make 10 burgers (3 and 3/4 ounces each) and we eat them for a few days.  They're great!
Very tasty! I used almond milk, and walnuts rather than pine nuts. Also used an extra couple Tbs of nutritional yeast for extra cheesiness. We'll make this again. Thanks for posting it!!!!!!!

Marra this is delicious, I was going to omit the brandy but then decided to add it and glad I did! I increased the cinnamon and brown sugar slightly and used dried cranberries, so good, thanks for sharing hon!..Kitten:)

I love this recipe!  It is delicious, simple, economical and filling!  It's also one of those recipes that I could imagine my mom making back in the late 60's or early 70's.   I used four, skin on "Smart Chicken" brand thighs for the meat and made the sauce as written.  It didn't make too much sauce for us, and I would probably double the sauce ingredients if I used two pounds of meat -- or a whole cut up chicken.  I didn't have the red wine and just used an extra half-cup of water.  I don't know that we even missed the wine flavor.  The sauce was awesome on it's own!!  After all the browning was done, I put it in a casserole, covered with foil and baked it in the oven at 350 degrees for 45 minutes and uncovered it the last 15 minutes and it was fork tender.  Next time I'll make the entire dish and freeze it in meal-size portions.  I had left-over angel hair in the freezer, so it was a very quick meal to get together.  Chef Mariajane, thank you for the wonderful recipe!  It's a keeper!

I made this for dinner tonight and it was really good.  The recipe is very general and subjective as far as how to make the actual sandwich.  I used a hoagie roll with some of the insides removed and cooked it on a George Forman Grill.  I guess is came out looking more like a panini, but it was really very, very good.  I made extra mayo/mustard sauce since this was awesome.

Recipe.Title: Salisbury Ground Pork Meatloaf With Apple and Sage

Text: I was really really excited to try this and it definitely didn't disappoint! I don't think I had a full pound of ground pork, so I lowered the amounts of salt and pepper, and used shallots because I was out of regular onions.  I used ground sage but I'll have to try it with fresh sage next time around! I was scared that maybe everyone wouldn't like the addition of the apples (my family tends to like savoury pork dishes rather than sweet) but you can't really make out that there's apple at all. It gives perhaps a hint of sweetness but also a nice texture to the meatloaf. I served this with my favourite barbecue sauce. I'll definitely be making this again! Thanks!
Perfect recipe! Imade it for my father in law...who has lived in Pittsburgh his entre life...and he  loved it! Thanks for posting!
This has been a big hit at our house. Fast and easy and the kids love it. Sometimes I use Ragu Double Cheddar and lots of cheddar cheese.
I used garlic powder instead of garlic salt and turkey pepperoni and these were a huge success!!  So easy and so good.
Took a bit of time to make, but was worth it. Not too hot either.

Recipe.Title: Mashed Potatoes With Creme Fraiche and Chives

Text: DELICIOUS!!!  My DS, who isn't fond of mashed potatoes even loved these potatoes!!!  I made 1/4 of the recipe and served it with recipe#61982 for one fantastic meal!!!  This is company worthy!!  This is going into the "Best of 2012" cookbook.  Thanks for sharing the recipe.  Made for ZWT8.
I sure do LOVES me Ruebens! Open faced even better! The broiling makes the cheese ooze to perfection. Thanks for posting this classic with a twist!
This was soooo good! So tasty and was a great change from a traditional BLT
Very easy and good! I didn't think there was going to be much flavor but I was wrong. Made according to instructions and will make again. Made for zwt 4
A bit sweet for me!  I'll reduce the honey next time ~ Made a nice steamy drink, and fogged up my snifter in my air conditioned room!  Made for Zaar Stars, due September 6th.
Very good and loaded with coconut & lime flavors.  The spinach especially tasted good with the lime- who knew that flavors would go well together.  A good recipe, and easy to prepare.

Wonderful pork chops! DH did put these on the grill after I marinated them for the afternoon. Next time I might try a little less honey but other than that, great recipe. Thank you wicked cook 46! Made and reviewed for New Zaar Tag.

Well cooking this was a bit of a circus as I knew I had to get it well done but still keep it moist (achieved that) - baked a 1.8K leg at 130C fan forced for 5 1/4 hours [but thought it would take 6 hours, so had to keep it warm - lowered oven to just warm and put a lid on the roast).  The vegies were cooking in the second oven and we bought it all together.  Did try making a gravy from the pan juices but did not work, tasted awful to be true to fact.  The DH was not at all keen on the flavour combination but I expected that and was hoping to convert him but the DS and I loved (but I would still prefer a bit of pink there but is out voted).  Thank you Peter, made as a pressie/recipenap for Aussie/NZ forum Swap #39 April 2010.
Very, very good! I pan roasted this on hob, first under lid and then without.
Great chili sauce, i really recommend it.

There's just the two of us, so I made this with two potatoes and 2 teaspoons of oil. I made all the seasoned breadcrumb mix with the idea of putting the rest in a zip-lock bag and making again if we liked it. We like it!! It's a winner recipe thank you!!!
Very delicious!  Just made enough for one, very easy to put together.  I cooked my mushrooms longer than required cus I like them browned before adding the other ingredients.  Wonderful flavour!

I didn`t have Cavenders All Purpose Greek Seasoning, so I used dried oregano, parsley, basil, garlic, onion powder, lemon zest black pepper. I mixed all the ingredients and let marinade for 1 hour then cooked. Made for ZRT6.
Thanks

Recipe.Title: Crispy Baked Chicken Leg Quarters (Very Easy, One Dish)

Text:
So crispy and so juicy.

I made this for my family of three, instead of using 4 quarters, I used 3 because they were so big. I did everything according to the recipe but added basil and pepper to the top of the chicken just before placing them in the oven. I was a bit uneasy about this recipe because I do not like soy sauce, but it was amazing. Thanks for sharing.

Recipe.Title: Lemon or Key Lime Icebox Pie

Text: Cool, Refreshing, and a Keeper in your recipe file for easy summer recipes.
One of my favorite side dishes!  I like to add a lot of black pepper for a little spice.  Thanks for posting!!

Made for ZWT-8, I decided to try some new Mex-style condiments. Your recipe jumped out of my PC & said "YOU GOTTA TRY ME" - mostly because 1 of my pet peeves here in Iceland is that they eat all their salads "undressed" & I'm definitely a generous dressing on top kinda girl. This is such a tasty quick-fix w/uses not limited to salads, so its versatility gets high marks from me too. Thx for sharing this recipe w/us. I'm glad I found it. :-)
Very good.  I mixed mine up like a martini.  This would be extra good in the summertime!
I made this for our dinner last night and is was really tasty! Nice Pizza!

This is wonderful!! Everyone LOVES them!!

I am keeping these in my fridge to give out in my x-mas baskets. We have a garden and have been pickling these as they grow. Has anyone experienced storing these for a couple months unopened? Do they keep?? Thanks!

Also, I am trying to make them per quart jar now (as the cucumbers are slow to grow at present.) Does anyone have suggestions on how to scale the ingredients?? Most specifically the brine?

Thank you!

Hey this is great!!  I'm always looking for different fig receipes. As I have a big fig tree in my front yard. I live in Portugal and from end of August till Oct. I have alot of figs, so this came in handy.  Thanks for sharring your receipe with us.

My grandmother was from the Azores. I make these from "sweetbread" recipe using 9 c. flour, 3 pkg dry yeast, 1 1/2c milk, 3/4c butter, 1 1/2 c water, 3 or 4 eggs, 1/3 c sugar some lemon juice and vanilla for flavor.  I use the dry mix method, let dough rise under an electric blanket once.  I stretch a handfull of dough and fry in 325 degree oil, drain quickly and roll in white sugar. Sometimes 350 is too hot and the "scones" are too dark. This could also be used for raised jelly donuts! To keep from getting soggy, don't cover with lid the 1st day and can repeat sugar coating thereafter. Yum!
Not only does this look like an asteroid pop, it tastes like one too. This was very easy to layer. Nice and sweet!

YUM!  I smoked a trout yesterday so I made this recipe and another similar one for dinner tonight.  I increased the fish but left the egg count the same (and next time I will only use 1 egg).  We actually preferred this recipe over the Paula Deen recipe - the main difference is that this version called for dijon mustard which gave it a nice tang.  I also added capers and onions which were great additions.   Would make this again.

Quite tasty!  Just the right amount of spice.  To make this more diabetic friendly, I only used half of the orange juice concentrate and left out the brown sugar, and it was still just fine!  We enjoyed Christmas day while just sitting around relaxing. I put this all in the crockpot early in the morning and let it simmer for about 3 hours.  Made for 2009 Partying The Diabetic Way game.
FANtastic!  I can't wait to think of other fruits & veggies to include.  Thanks for the recipe!

We loved the spices as they were, but since we had a 1-pound loin roast, it would have helped to have some extra liquid in the roasting pan so I could baste the roast throughout, as it took considerably longer than 20 minutes. Next time I will add some pineapple juice to the roasting pan.  We used wild boar, which was probably leaner than traditional pork tenderloin.  DH thought it tasted great, anyway!  Thanks for sharing, weekend cooker! Made for 1-2-3-4 Hit Wonders.

Recipe.Title: Spanish Burgers With Romesco and Manchego Cheese

Text: This was just ok for us, DH really didn't care for the sauce I liked it a little more. I used yellow pepper in place of the red. It's always good to try something new even if it's not exactly to our liking - thanks for sharing. Made for ZWT 8 by one of The Wild Bunch

Recipe.Title: Mexican Chocolate Drop Cookies: Cooking Light

Text: LOVED these. didn't have bittersweet choc., so i used about 6 oz. chocolate chips - and 1T cocoa. then i decreased the sugar a bit. i also made these vegan by using vegan butter and a "flax egg". they were amazing. <br/>LOVED the cayenne pepper in these. just a hint of hot as you finish each bite.<br/>i took these to our homeschool co-op as we celebrated Mexican Independence Day. 2 of the three moms who attend are Mexican - and they both loved these cookies. the kids loved them too. they were gone quickly.<br/>my batch made exactly 32 cookies.<br/>thanks for posting this. i'll be making these again.
Yum! Wish I had tried this recipe sooner. I do believe it has become my favorite turkey burger recipe. Easy, juicy and flavorful. Thanks for posting this recipe!

I didn't know what size cookie sheet to use for this, so I halved the recipe & made it in my small bar cookie pan (Pampered Chef stoneware), sprayed with non-stick cooking spray.  The pan still seemed too large for the recipe so I made a dam with aluminum foil halfway across the pan & patted the crumble into just half of the pan.  It was still a little thin feeling, but I know next time I'll just make the full recipe & can still use the bar cookie pan.  I don't have any cookie sheets with sides, but that would be a must with this recipe, as the syrup would run right off the edge of a flat pan.  The instructions don't say how long to cook the syrup either, so I boiled it hard & stirred for 2 minutes before pouring it over the rhubarb.  It baked for the full 60 minutes and the final result tastes wonderful!  Sweet & tart, crunchy & chewy.  It's a very beautiful dessert!  Thanks for sharing the recipe, CJAY!  Made & enjoyed for June's Photo Forum event Undercover:  Pies & Tarts.

Yummy. I had forgotten how good the ploughman's lunches were. I didn't have the plum and apple so used Branston pickle which is often part of the cheese and chutney combination.  Because the store was out of anything like a chewy white bread i used a mild rye which has lots of flavor and chewiness to approximate it

Delicious! This looks time consuming but it was really easy. Due to time constraints I only marinated the chops for a few hours, but they were still delicious. I did not have any chili sauce on hand (go figure - I always have it on hand?.?.?) so I used Recipe #52689 . Turned out great. I used the grill method. Great flavors, my family had high praises!!

A take on Cha Khoai Tay with necessary RSC ingredients added and adjusted to qualify for the contest. 
I did use jarred lemongrass. I liked the free flow of the patties. I did remove from pan when fried and placed on paper towels to absorb the excess oil and place in the oven to keep warm. I used a 1/4 cup to make 12 patties.  I used Recipe #414471.
Close to this recipe here
http://www.recipehound.com/Recipes/1166.html
 Enjoyed!

I really enjoyed this very meaty chili.  It isn't spicy, but has plenty of flavor from the herbs & spices that are added.  Salt & Pepper isn't mentioned, I added both to taste.  For the tomatoes, I just added a handful of cherry tomatoes and about 4-5 small vine tomatoes I had in the house, crushed.  I liked that this wasn't too tomato-ey.

Tons of flavor in every bite!  Just the aroma while it was cooking was divine!  I did add the bacon with the chicken, so that the chicken could soak up more of the flavor.  Then I proceeded as directed.  The flavor of the sauce is wonderful; I just wish the consistency was thicker, and would probably thicken it with some cornstarch next time.  Overall, a lovely dish that I will make again.  Made for ZWT 8.

I made this recently for PAC and served it with Curried lentils. I couldn't find the Barberries anywhere (still curious about those as I had never heard of them and the name is cool lol). Even with the one ingredient missing this was a hit. We tend to like fruity savoury dishes in our household and this one will definitely be a repeat. It isn't something you want to make if you're wanting highly spiced (I DID end up putting some garlic in it for a bit of balance) and it also needs salt when finished to bring out the flavors some. But this is a mild fruity rice dish that I think would be just as good w/out the chicken and served as a side dish. Will make again. Thanks Pattikay!

Utterly delish! The flavourings were very subtle and quite beautiful. 

Cooked this for friends doing weight watchers and everyone had seconds, saying they were the best meatballs theyâ€™d ever had- no one could believe they were also so healthy. BIG thank you! We are having this again this week.

I cooked these dipped in egg, rolled in whole wheat breadcrumbs and baked in the oven at 325F for 25 mins. Which helped â€œhealthyâ€� it up a lot!

We ate this served with whole wheat spaghetti, fresh tomato marinara sauce, and salad.

A delightfully unusual dish.   This is a perfect blend of sweet and spicy flavors. The pepper gave it more heat than I expected; next time I may cut back a little. Thanks so much for posting!  Made for ZWT6.

Recipe.Title: Kotopoulo Skorthato (Lemon Garlic Chicken With Potatoes)

Text: Easy and superbly flavoursome - which means I'll certainly be making this again.  I scaled the recipe back for two and used (skin on) chicken thighs.  I still cooked more potatoes than we ate for this meal as I anticipated - correctly - that cooked with so many yummy ingredients that they would be enjoyed over the next few days in other dishes.  The only changes I made were to proportionally increase the garlic (as we love garlic) and to use part Recipe #135453 and part white wine instead of water.  On the recommendation of other reviewers I turned the potatoes when I turned the chicken so that they were well-flavoured with the amazingly delicious juices.  My chicken and potatoes were in the oven for about an hour and 10 minutes.  I followed AuntSana's superb idea for reducing the fat: a nifty trick which I'll also be using for other recipes.  Thank you, Ravenseyes, for sharing this wonderful recipe!

Recipe.Title: Grilled Turkey Breast With Mango-Lime Salsa

Text: This review is for the salsa - we had it with grilled chicken.  Tasty tasty!  Thanks for posting and I'll have to try your turkey!!

I did half the recipe and made 42 cookies.  Instead of 5/8 cup sugar, I used 1/2 cup sugar.  I used quick oats.  I soaked the raisins like you suggested.  I used skim milk.  After 10 minutes cooking they were perfect.  They're chewy and have a great texture.  The taste is wonderful.  I'll do them again for sure.  Thanks Valgal :)  Made for PAC spring 2010
The sauce on these was perfect and I would definitely make these again. Added a little sriracha sauce and this helped to spice things up abit.

Recipe.Title: Chili's  Margarita Grilled Chicken and Belinda's Mexican Rice

Text: Tried this recipe as written. Marinated the chicken tenders I used about 4-5 hours. The chicken picked up the margarita mix and was very enjoyable and tasty. Served with Mexican rice topped with black beans and chopped onions.

Syd, this one was another winner for me.  I used approx 1/2 lb of baby carrots which I sliced in half lengthwise (in fourths lengthwise if the baby carrot was very tick).  I halved the rest of the ingredients.  After this cooled off I took a bite, and oh wow, what an addictive way to munch carrots.  I can't wait to see how they turn out later but I don't doubt they'll be fantastic then too. :D  Made for Please Review My Recipe tag game.  I'll be making thees again for sure.  Thanks for sharing, Syd!

Recipe.Title: Cheesecake Factory Chicken Tortilla Soup - Copycat

Text:
Love this recipe, but since I don't usually buy whole chicken, I used 5 chicken breasts instead. I didn't use the whole chicken so I used a quart of chicken stock
I love poblano peppers, I seeded 2 and used them. You can also add 2 small cans of green chilies. When making this I also subtracted some of the water and added 3 15 oz. cans of tomato sauce.I like how it looks and tastes better.
Finally I crushed a bag of 14 oz tortilla chips which helps to thicken the soup.

Such an easy recipe to prpeare and make.
I also used breasts for this recipe and followed exactly, so easy and such wonderful flavours!
This made for an easy dinner for DH and myself.
It was served rice and vegetables, which made for an easy and great tasting meal, we both loved this.
Thanks Pat great recipe!

Recipe.Title: Vegetarian Lentil Taco 'meat Filling' Substitute (Crock Pot)

Text: I have picky kids and they gobbled this up.  My little 3 year old said he didn't want to eat it, then he tried it and said yummy.  He wanted more!  Thank you for the recipe!
I used tomato basil tortillas for this recipe, skipped the cheese as I am lactose intolerant, love the addition of avacados. Will definitely make again.

made these today for pre-thanksgiving dinner. We added more champagne than listed, but everyone loved them. Great special occasion drink. tagged in november bev tag. sorry no picture, forgot the camera.

7-10 STARS!!!

My only caveat is that I didn't use ALL the broth. I was shy about a cup, thinking I didn't want to over cook. Better over than under, I say.

DELICIOUS DELICIOUS DELICIOUS. Smells amazing while cooking (after the wine, I used a champagne/sparkling wine). The chives and wine and butter are a winning combination.

I used an oninon in place of 2 shallots. and canned mushrooms for half the mushrooms (not cooking them but adding them to the others) and a bit more parmesan cheese and slightly more chives.

Don't forget the addition of salt and pepper, espically the pepper. 

USE ALL THE BROTH!!!

One of my favorite recipes on the Zaar!

Recipe.Title: Easy One Pot K-D Taco Supper

Text: This kind of reminded us of Hamburger Helper.  Not a bad thing, just not what I was expecting.  As I have been sick but the kids still need feeding (don't they always??) I needed something fast, easy, and using ingredients I had on hand.  This fit the bill.  Thanks!

Recipe.Title: Barbecue Meatloaf - Delicious and Weight Watchers

Text: Super simple and tasted great!!

These are amazing!
I will for sure keep this in my recipe arsenal.
Using the recipe for 12 muffins, I managed to make 24 mini muffins and 6 regular muffins.
All I had to do was increase the amount for the garnish.
I plan on giving them as gifts, and can't wait to see how others react :)

I used my home canned very low sugar drained peaches (4+cups) with 4 cups of low fat unflavored unsweetened yogurt and over 1/2 cup honey. It still wasn't very sweet and was very mild fruit flavor (I may add lemon juice next time for a brighter flavor).<br/>I also added 3 TBSP. blackberry brandy to keep it from freezing so hard but still is way too firm to scoop unless I pull the container out of the freezer 20 min. before serving. I can not detect the brandy flavor--may use more of that next time too.<br/>Thanks for posting--I'm sure it's great as written.

This was SO FABULOUS!  I made it with mushrooms and pea pods.  I loved having the sauce (out of simple ingredients that I always have on hand!) ready and hot in a saucepan nearby.  It made it all so easy and fast.  I didn't have peanut oil but just used vegetable oil and I didn't used a full cup of oil for frying (maybe 1/4 to 1/3 cup total).  Also, because the Mongolian Beef I've had in restaurants is usually a bit spicy, I added a teaspoon or so of jarred chili-garlic sauce for a bit of heat -- perfect. But it would be delicious without too I'm sure.  Try it! I'm glad I did!  Thanks.

Oh, my we like these! I usually use any "dead" bread we have in the freezer, but we generally eat firmer bread anyway. I've even added a few leftover hamburger or hot dog buns to these. To -day was the second time I've made them, this time by request of my picky grandson. A cross between pancakes and French toast, the fact that the leftover bread gets used for something different is an added plus.  We served them with home made blackberry syrup--yum. Will have often- the recipe is in my standards cookbook. Thanks!

Recipe.Title: Wilted Spinach Salad With Sherry Vinaigrette

Text: delicious. simple. a keeper. thanks for sharing.

I absolutely love this recipe. It's quite easy to make, and the flavor is really great! My whole family loves it. I like to try new things so I don't make repeat dinners often, but this is on the "several times a month" list by family request.

Made 1/2 of the recipe for myself for lunch and then the next day for supper.  I had a large red onion in the refrigerator that needed to be used so I added it and marinated all day. DH grilled the vege's and I loved the smokey flavor from the grill and the bit of tang from the marinade. A keeper for me! Made and reviewed for the ZWT8 - 2010.

I used quart jars and a little extra garlic.  These are delicious.  Don't try to can them--heating will destroy any resemblance to Claussens(the kids at the neighborhood block party made me VERY aware of that). Thanks for posting!

I kind of feel bad only giving this 4 stars but like many, I like to reserve 5 stars for recipes with "wow"!  This is a wonderful, basic, crock pot veggie barley soup.  You can add or subtract veggies.  I confess I cook it over night and put it in the lunch for work that day in the morning.  But everyone needs a basic recipe just like this.  Give it a try!

I made as per recipe with one exception that I chose to bake in the oven rather than grill/broil otherwise I used 960 grams (about 2lb - being 9 wings) of wings before tips removed (which I freeze for stock) but made full recipe - baked in a single layer on foiled lined tray lightly sprayed with oil for 40 minutes for succulent and very tasty wings with all 3 plates only ending up with polished bones as any evidence of dinner, thank you dicentra, made for Name that Ingredient tag game.
Yum!  I had a few cans of salmon from Trader Joe's that I didn't know what to do with.  Made a great quick lunch!  Thank you!

Recipe.Title: Jumbo Shrimp Rolls With a Sweet Soy Sauce

Text: Fantastic recipe Chili Spice. I can't believe that I made these, they were quick and easy to make with fantastic results. I used Collasal Shrimp...what a treat. I made the dip, it was delish and went perfectly with the shrimp rolls. The savory flavoring was the perfect foil for the succulent shrimp. We really enjoyed the addition of the red curry.  I can't wait to make these again. Thank you so much for sharing, another recipe that I will be making so often.
Very good. But rather expensive. It cost me over 2 grand to fly to Istanbul for the bay leaf.

The flavor of this bread is good. I think it should have baked for a few more minutes as the center of the bread seemed a bit doughy.  I have a new oven so it may be that the temperature is a bit off.Other than that the texture was fine. I expect rye bread to be somewhat dense. It's very easy to make. A definite keeper. Made for PRMR tag.

I tried this for Grouper and Hogfish and it was great then I used it on some lobster OMG, Fantastic!!! It is a great marinade for a dinner party super easy and your guests will think you slaved forever. 
I also took the leftover marinade and reduced it in a fying pan made a perfect glaze.

Excellent and easy recipe.
Thank you Charlotte J. for posting this on zaar.
I only added cinnamon and a little more sugar. I like them sweet. I put butter and real maple syrup on them and they were gone in a flash. My dad was impressed and said they were good. My 24 year old son is visiting us and he liked them too.
I was lazy this morning and used the Kichenaid mixer to whip the egg whites with a pinch of Cream of Tartar. I mixed all the ingredients up to the egg whites in the mixer too then I folded in the egg whites by hand. Really super waffles. Thank you again.

What a great soup for a cold winter day. I halved the recipe for myself but forgot to reduce the brown sugar so it was a little on the sweet side but still oh so good. I didn't add as much water as I wanted a fuller flavor and I did use the sherry. I think the sherry is what really gives the soup the flavor. I was a little unsure about the Worcestershire sauce but it went over well. I only put mozzarella cheese on top of the soup then popped it in the oven until the cheese was melted and brown. Made for Best of Cookbook 2012.

This was super fast, and super yummy, too! This was the perfect ending to a light grilled dinner. I used fresh strawberries and pureed them with my immersion blender (which cleans up much easier than my food processor). The kids liked stirring them up into "milkshakes". Thank you so much for posting! Made and reviewed for ZWT5, for the Groovy GastroGnomes.

Made this for Little Miss and Hubby and they both enjoyed it.  I had to leave out the carrots because I didn't have any at home, but other then this everything was kept as written.  They both really enjoyed it.  Thanks for posting your recipe Tisme
I have the Farm Journal Pie Cookbook too and I just love the double blueberry pie recipe!  You forgot to drown it in whipped cream to really guild the lily!  Thanks for posting! SA;)

Really enjoyed this.  It pulled together super quick and cooked perfectly.  I cut the recipe in half, so it fit perfectly in a deep dish pie plate and it only needed 30 minutes in the oven.  Fed 4 people with a side dish.  I took another reviewers recommendation and through in some shredded carrot which gave it nice flavor.  And only had about 1 tbsp of cooked crumbled bacon so I threw that in and it was enough to give the casserole a nice mild smoky flavor.  This reminds me of a bisquik casserole.  Made for ZWT4.  Will be making again!

I got several prickly pears in a Bountiful Basket and after trying them wasn't a real fan. To be honest,  this recipe appealed to me based on ease of not only preparation, but getting them used up before they went bad. I'm not sure if I felt my appetite was tamed, but I did notice my energy level pick up. I have to say I held my breath while sipping, the flavor and sent of prickly pear isn't appealing to me. I have a feeling I may have tossed them if I hadn't tried this.  Thanks for posting.
Mmmm... This was really good! I cut back on the butter and used whole wheat couscous. I ate this for breakfast with a poached egg on top!

I loved justcallmetoni's idea of using this recipe to make kebabs, so that's what I did. I threaded the cubed chicken pieces onto wooden skewers with chunks of mushrooms, red peppers and onion and marinated the kebabs for 24 hours. The only things I omitted from the marinade were the hot sauce and the cracked pepper (personal taste preferences) but I did include several grindings of black pepper. Great marinade and the chicken was just so delicious. I panfried my kebabs which we thoroughly enjoyed with loof's Recipe #266129. Thank you for sharing another easy and delicious recipe, MsSally. Made for Everyday is a Holiday Tag!

I'd think that if you wanted less of a banana taste, you'd want to use a greener banana, since the ripe ones have the most flavor! Anyway, I did use a nicely yellowed one that was frozen, something I usually use in these kinds of drinks for their 'frost' factor! You have a very tasty smoothie here & a recipe that I'll definitely make again! Thanks for sharing it! [Made & reviewed for one of my adopted chefs in this Spring's Pick A Chef]

Move over Hamburger Helper!  Jodie's got a better alternative that's just as simple.  I loved this because it reminds me of eating goulash in college.  Somehow I wound up with twice as many noodles so I added another can of tomatoes, a bunch of bell peppers, and a lot of cheddar cheese.  I wanted a little more bite so I threw in some red pepper, then added garlic, salt,  and pepper.  I will remember this dish when I feel like going out to eat because cooking seems too time-consuming  and I'd have to go to the store to make anything.  You probably have everything you need on hand, or you could make it up based on what's in the kitchen cupboard.  If I had mushrooms, I definitely would have added them.  Very hearty and satisfying.  Made for Fall 2009 Pick a Chef.  Thank you Celestial Star!

Diner you have a real winner of a scone recipe here!  I used cake flour and then half-and-half as you had listed in the ingredients.  I found using the cake flour did present a softer texture to the scones than I'm used to which was a very pleasant treat. Definitely will be making this one again and again!  Thanks for sharing in NZT game! :)

June 8, '07

May 28th, '07 This is the best ever!!!! My DH is sooo addicted with this one. It's a keeper. Thanks a million again, Kit for sharing!!! Big hugs, Glen of Coolidge, Arizona Hi again Kit, I made this for dinner last night and OOOH MY GOSH!!!! It was "DELICIOUS." Very very tasty and yummy. EXCELLENT RECIPE. Good job, Kit. I'll be making this again for our guests today. I can't wait to hear what they think. Thanks a million, Kit for sharing this. Yummy, yummy!! I made this again last night but i didn't use cream of chicken soup instead, I put 1 cup of GRATED PARMESAN CHEESE, i used half and half instead of milk and use more sour cream iN it. Recipe.Title: Kittencal's Slow Cooker Eye of Round Roast With Gravy

Text: WOW! This is really good and for a crockpot recipe it came out darn tastey. I did add in more garlic, I can't help myself. I also had to change the mushroom soup to celery soup due to medical restrictions. The sauce/gravy this makes is great. Served with smashed potatoes and corn (frozen from summer harvest). This was the perfect dinner as most of family is home with cold and stuffiness. (They come to visit and are ill for vacation) Anyway this is great! For me what a time saver as it let me do a large pot of chicken soup on the stove and know dinner would be done as well. I love crockpot dinners and this ranks right up there. Made for Kittencal's Cookathon 2008. Thanks Kitten!  edited to add: used the minimal amount of leftovers, watered down the gravy a bit and threw in some additional beef broth and veggies to simmer.  Chopped up the leftover, leftovers  of beef and made a quick soup.  YUMMY!

It didn't have much flavor and wasn't sweet enough. Sadly, we ended up throwing most of it out. If I were to make it again...I would try peeling and dicing the persimmons and adding extra brown sugar and spices.

Instead of the 2 cups of chocolate chips, I used 1/2 cup bittersweet chocolate chips, 1/4 cup cocoa, 1/2 cup sugar and 1/4 cup water (I added the cocoa and water to the chocolate on the stove). Although a great many similar recipes exist, roasting chicken at 250 degrees for 5 hours is risky.  That temperature is definitely outside the USDA guidelines, and bacteria may be growing and multiplying quite a while.  Poultry, especially, should not be cooked at less than 325 degrees. To be safe use the same spices but increase the temperature to 325 and decrease the oven time. Allow about 20 minutes per pound for the roasting time. The safest way to determine doneness is to use a meat thermometer and make sure the final temperature, in the thigh, is the 180 degrees  stated in this recipe.
Delicious to the extreme! Salty crust outside and honey buttered inside.

This was delicious. I used frozen blueberries (had some that had been in the freezer for a while & wanted to use them, plus fresh ones are still expensive this time of year) and if I were to use frozen again I would add some flour to the berries to absorb some of the extra liquid. I would also add a little salt (maybe 1/4 tsp) to the topping. Otherwise followed the recipe but used regular A-P flour and butter instead of margarine (softened in the microwave for 15 seconds). Made as directed the first time and adjusted to our liking the second time thusly;
-break pasta strands into bite size pieces before cooking
-only 3/4 can of the beans, rinsed and mashed in the food processor
-chop only the best potions of the artichoke hearts
-only 1/4 c chipotle sauce
-don't drain the pasta mixture, let it rest for 15 min before combining with the remainder of the ingredients
Chill before serving.

Recipe.Title: Spicy, Low-Fat Veggie Burgers (Vegan, Gluten-Free, Soy-Free

Text: These are awesome! And the recipe was flexible enough to succeed even though I fiddled a little based on what was in the cupboard... I used black beans, cashews, and skipped the jalapeno and ground red pepper. In hindsight, I should have upped the chili powder a little to compensate, but I am a bit of a spice wimp... Rather than getting my grater out, I plugged in the food processor and just threw everything in all at once. Worked perfectly! I made them on my indoor grill and they held together very nicely. Once this batch disappears, I'm going to make another to keephandy in the freezer!

Text: This was very easy to prepare and the tuna came out just right.  The sauce had good potential,  but I think the 3 1/2 Tbs of wasabi was too much.  Maybe 3 1/2 tsp would have been better.  DH and I are not wimpy in the heat and spice department, but the sauce burned our noses, making the tuna hard to eat.  If the wasabi was reduced, I think the sauce would be very good.  We skipped the daikon radishes.  I served with Recipe #225328 225328, which paired nicely as a side.

Next time I would probably use a little more bacon to make sure that all of the stuffing stayed in, or maybe just pile sauerkraut on top when it's done! lol. Oh - and I used Monterey Jack cheese since the only cheddar I had on hand was greated. Thanks GailAnn for a nice meal yet again. Made for Everyday is a Holiday Tag.

Definite 5* recipe you have here sharflan! Simple, delicious and still has the wow factor for company. My family thought it was just wonderful. I decorated the pie with limes only because I didn't have a lemon left to garnish it with. Thx so much for sharing this winner recipe! Made for Spring Pick A Chef 2011.
This was pretty good ... perfect for 2 people. Dh actually made it. The only change was we used low fat sausage.

Dr.Jenny thanks for posting. Made for St.Patrick's Day today and it was delicious. The fresh cilantro and Romano are essential. The dish is light yet creamy. I served it with Irish soda bread. Everyone from kids to adults ate it all. Easy and fast. Enjoy! ChefDLH

This is the "BEST", I know it because I am Aunt Gwyn ; )
Do not skip the cheddar cheese, it's a must and I promise, it adds so much to the taste. I haven't met anyone that doesn't love it.
Lovely crisp spuds with a great "twang" from the lemon. Rather than use good broth, I used stock cubes & water to save on waste, worked a treat.
Fantastic!!!
This was fantastic! Served with slider rolls and King's Hawaiian rolls. Hubby suggested adding a little liquid smoke next time, and there will definitely be a next time!

My family used this for a light supper the other night, and it was delicious. We never used a baguette before, but it was definetely a good idea, and it was almost sandwhich-y in nature. We used plenty of tomatoes, as we are tomato lovers, and white button mushrooms.
I made this for my book club and everyone LOVED it!  Big hit and easy to make.  I added olives to a few and artichoke hearts to a few others - all were so yummy!

Recipe.Title: Deb's Favorite Way to Eat Fresh Fruit

Text: I've gone to Fruit Heaven.  Debbie, this is amazing.  I used the Fat Free sour creme on blueberries, peaches and cherries. Everyone HAS to try this.  This is going to be a regular....VERY regular item in my house.  Made for the Auzzie/NZ Recipe Swap #31

I made this with no added sugar and used light whipped topping (the frozen kind) in place of the real whipped cream.  I also used less lime juice since I was using less sugar. Any kind of liquor works.  Wonderful and easy.

Excellent flavor. The turkey breast was a little larger so I decided not to stuff it and after preparing according to instructions I layed it on top of the stuffing.  I should have weighed it as the weight was not readable. It took much longer than anticipated to reach the correct temperature, about an hour longer. The stuffing that was not under the breast did get quite crispy but was still good. I am thinking that the breast may have not completely thawed prior to putting in the oven. However, the turkey meat was so wonderfully moist. This was a skin on breast which likely helped retain moisture. I did add a handful of dried cranberries into the stuffing mixture which added a nice dimension. I am going to try this with chicken pieces next. Thanks for sharing your recipe.

Recipe.Title: Soy Dipping Sauce (For Pot Stickers or Egg Rolls)

Text: Been searching for a good pot sticker sauce recipe like our local restaurant.  This sauce comes very close.  We added twice the sugar to get the flavor we wanted.  Made for AZ swap#25.

Recipe.Title: Baked Fish With Potatoes, Onions, Saffron and Paprika

Text: This was wonderful! I used ling cod and the only change I made was to use local brown onions because we don't have vidalia onions widely available in Aus. As you said makes a really healthy and tasty meal along with a few salad greens and it's also quick to put together so what more could you want.

Recipe.Title: Banana And/Or Coconut Cream Pie from Scratch

Text: The filling is outstanding! Doubled  the coconut w/o banana and other than that made as posted. Chose to use cool whip so we could enjoy leftovers next day. Made this pastry recipe, followed directions, guessed at water amount.  Baked pastry longer, used glass pan.  Thank you for sharing.

Mmmm Mmmmmmm Good. I added a few finely chopped pecans into the cake as well as in the topping, used Splenda for both sugars. I made a half recipe and got 3 lovely mini loaves from that. Each mini loaf is just right for DH and myself to split. Everything comes together beautifully for a delicious, fluffy and very satisfying treat.

This is delicious! I followed it almost directly and it tastes great!! I didn't have salt so I didn't add it into the soup but its got enough flavor from the chicken bouillon cubes. Also my husband came home late so after adding the cream and bacon I let it simmer on low about a 3 for 30 minutes, potatoes and kale still in tact just soft which was perfect! And there's a lot for left overs which I love!

I decided to try this recipe one day on a whim and it turned out to be such a hit.  It's so quick to make, you can mix all of the ingredients during the time the pasta is boiling!  Before you know it, your meal is ready.  I also tried baking it for a bit to really melt the cheese.  I highly recommend the recipe.

These turned out amazing. Quick and easy. I should have only made half a batch though cuz one batch was 40 cookies. I made these for my boyfriend on base and i dont think him and his roommate can eat that many.

This was the first time I had a go at granola - I loved it and its so easy to make! The sad thing is I've run out of maple syrup which is hard to get here...sigh! Thanks for this yummy breakfast recipe!

Bravo Zach!
Many of my FAVORITE ingredients.  I always have imitation crab, cucumbers and rice. Plus - I am addicted to avocados : )
I'll probably sprinkle on a little ground coriander too.  I add that to everything.
Thanks Zack

Holy moly that's good!!! I'm from Texas, so I know my way around a "Co-cola" cake. This one is divine! I omitted the marshmallow and it was perfect. Be sure to make some holes in the cake before you pour in the frosting. Yum!!!

I've often wondered what General Tso chicken would be like with grilled chicken. I appreciate you posted this one to try! This was so much easier than the regular way, which made it perfect for a weeknight meal. The whole family enjoyed. Thanks for posting!
Roxygirl
Made for the Best of 2008 Recipe Tag: This chicken was outstanding - perfect combination of flavors!

Recipe.Title: White Chocolate Fruit and Nut Truffles

Text: Wonderful treat.  Very easy and fast to put together, and quite pretty.  I did change it up slightly, by rolling it in coconut instead of dipping in chocolate.  I only have unsweetened dried cranberries, so it's quite mild where sweetness is concerned.:)  If I could make just one suggestions.... because of varying sizes of oranges, it would be helpful if there was an actually measurement for the juice.  Fabulous creation Paula.  Made for Winter 2011 Hidden Gems

Awesome recipe and so very easy! Thanks Paula for yet another GREAT recipe!!  Updated as I have altered this for our tastes.  I use split bone in chicken breasts (and brining is a MUST).  I add 1/4 cup frozen raspberries and 1 pepper (jar or canned whatever I can find and freeze remaining for next time).  AMAZING!  I like to serve with Spanish Rice and a tossed salad.

Very good!  Instead of boiled chicken, I marinated 3 chicken breasts and baked them in the oven.  Otherwise, followed the recipe to a T, and it was great.  Served in pita pockets with spinach leaves and diced tomatoes.

This was indeed quick and easy!  It was amazing to see how it got thicker before it got thinner, and the finished product was absolutely delicious.  After tasting it, I did add generous amounts of salt and garlic powder, and a dash of smoked paprika, even though I was using it as a sauce rather than a meze.  It made for a lovely lunch over some falafel on a bed of salad veggies.  I can't wait to try it in pita sandwiches.  Made for Veggie Swap.

This was sooo nice!! The main recipe was very similar to another cake recipe I had which always turns out gorgeous. So I upped the flour to 2 cups, then I put 1 and a half teaspoons each of bicarbonate of soda and baking soda. The only other changes were I used chocolate chips instead of nuts and reduced the sugar to 2/3 of a cup. I had some caramel in the fridge so I spread that on the cake once cooled then topped with whipped cream. Absolutely delicious!!

Recipe.Title: The Neeley's Kansas City Baby Back Ribs Dry Rub and Cook Method

Text: This is an amazing receive !!!! First time making!!! Would recommend keeping eye on temp of grill though...kept going too hot, too cool... Adjust tps accordingly...
OUTSTANDING! I used regular black pepper instead of cayenne.  Made for ZWT 7.

I don't do McDonald's, but I gave this to a friend who was searching for the real deal because, of all the wannabe recipes out there, this is the one that just sounded right to me.  She called just now to say that it was fabulous and her family just freaked out at how close it was to the original.

I love red hots and this was delicious! Even my DD couldn't get enough of these!! The smell as they were cooking reminded me of the fall. I will be making them again when the weather turns cooler!!  Made for photo tag 08'. Thanks for posting CaliforniaJan!!

My first experience with making my own meat substitute.  I left out the "sweeter" spices, but added onion like others did.  I'll definitely make this again, cause I can see flavoring this with crumbled seaweed to make a fish patty, using poultry seasoning for turkey type things.  I will either double wrap this next time or cook less, as mine got pretty dark on the down side of my log.  Tasty though.  Thanks for sharing.

I was very pleased with the flavour of this mock sour cream. It was delicious, especially for something so lo cal and diet friendly. I served this with baked potatoes as suggested in the intro. Made for Kittencal's forum Recipe Tag Game.

I'm making a vat of this to keep in the fridge for all kinds of uses.  A wonderful sauce and just the right amount of heat.  DH loved it too.  We made it twice this weekend.  Once for recipe #325074 and as a dipping sauce for frites.  Made for ZWT6 by a fellow Looney Spoon Phoodie.

Recipe.Title: Chianti Braised Short Ribs Crock Pot

Text: This recipe was super easy & the ribs turned out tender & tasty.  Adding this one to our regular rotation at home!
We are going to have an island night with compulsory cocktails,thought I would give this a try,this is ideal,Love it!!!!
This was simply fantastic.  There is just no need for canned soup when you can put together something of this quality so effortlessly!  Highly-recommended.

I followed the recipe with a few minor modifications. I like olives, so I used a lot more than called for, and sliced them so they ended up about equal to the carrots and peppers. I didn't have fresh tomatoes so I used one can of diced tomatoes. I used chicken broth I already had instead of boullion with water. It was really good served over cous-cous.

Recipe.Title: Heart Smart Bisquick Buffalo Chicken Bake

Text: This is a great dish!  I wanted it to taste like a Buffalo Chicken Pizza so I drizzled some ranch dressing (about 1/4 cup) over the batter.  I subbed mozzarella for the bleu cheese.  Thanks for sharing.  ***Made for Fall PAC 2012***

Recipe.Title: Shredded Potato Baskets With Cheese and Bacon #5FIX

Text: These look delicious - I'm thinking of them as an appetizer for Easter. I'm sure they will be popular since they have everyone's favorite ingredients.
All I want for Christmas is a million bucks. Either that or an order of Val’s cranberry salsa. Delish and Merry Christmas 2016!

Loved the combination of fruits in this salad! For the rock melons I used cantalope and skipped the dressing part of the salad along with the passion fruit pulp, which isn't available in my neck of the woods. For breakfast today I am having the leftover fruit salad with the yogurt. Thanks for sharing this keeper which I will be having often - next time adding the dressing too!

Easy, unforgettable, creamy, YUMMY! I added a {light} sprinkle of ground cardamom to
the top. Drank before before going to bed and I slept blissfully! Thank you! Reviewed for NA*ME tag/Summer Edition.

This was pretty good! I made a couple changes, I used chicken broth instead of the wine, I added 1 can of regular cream of chicken soup for more sauce. I added some steamed broccoli at the end and let it cook a while longer as I cooked a spaghetti squash in the microwave. I served this over the squash. It was a great way low carb meal!

Recipe.Title: Rosemary Chicken for Crock Pot or Dutch Oven

Text: This recipe was OK. Eat-able but I won't try this one again. Easy to do with ingredients to hand but I felt that the chicken lost too much of it's texture and that flavour was weak. Perhaps try this on if you are feeling sick people or have a bland palate or have difficulty chewing.

Delicious salad which we enjoyed with grilled chicken (recipe#120513). The changes I made was using slightly different amount of the ingredients listed -- but I think this recipe is very adaptable to different additions/canned fruit. Thanks for sharing!
https://noevalleybakery.com/products/got-milk-cake
This is tatsty but I'm a bit of a wuss so it was a little string for me, I ended up adding more pineapple juice to dilute it a bit. Made for ANZ Swap August 2008.
Pretty good, tasted just like Naan, but pretty time consuming and we needed to add a lot of flour to make it workable.

I made this on 11/6/11 for the Universal Dishes/Child's Play Event in the Food Photo Forum,and most importantly for our dinner :). To save a step,while browning the beef, the onion and garlic were added.Since I'm a wimp,only one can of the green chilies were added.
